alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 2:54PM CDT until May 30 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following county, Red Willow. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
